Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision to deny the applicant's refugee claim was based on reasonable credibility assessments and evidence
Decision_Level: Refugee Protection Division (RPD) of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility determination upheld due to inconsistencies in documentation
Evidence_Type: Inconsistent addresses, incorrect logos, document errors
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility issues arising from inconsistent or questionable documentation
Application_Error: Minor discrepancies in documents such as addresses, logos, and formatting
Assessment_Standard: Patent unreasonableness standard applied to credibility findings
Application_Factor: Applicant's explanations for discrepancies deemed insufficient
Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility concerns related to false or inconsistent statements in documentation
Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancies in supporting documents; lack of evidentiary support for explanations
Document_Fraud: Alleged inaccuracies in official-looking documents (e.g., logos, addresses)
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in personal history and documentation
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant argued discrepancies were minor and adequately explained
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada - Federal immigration and refugee law
